alert.note: Alert for Burleigh; Emmons; McIntosh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 25 at 8:48AM CST until December 25 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. * WHERE...Much of south central North Dakota, including areas along and south of Interstate 94 and the southern James River Valley. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous Today, and Sunday through Monday. For Sunday through Monday, travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A narrow band of heavier snow may produce localized amounts as high as 6 to 8 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
